dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did you see that Steven Spielberg is actually the richest celebrity at 9.7 billion dollars?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did you see that Steven Spielberg is actually the richest celebrity at nine point seven billion dollars?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: George Lucas He edges fellow filmmaker Steven Spielberg (No. 2; $3.7 billion) and media mogul Oprah (No. 3; $2.8 billion).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and George Lucas is way down at number nine with only a hundred million. That's uh, a pretty big gap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and George Lucas is way down at number nine with only a hundred million. That's uh, a pretty big gap.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: America's Wealthiest Celebrities 2018 1. George Lucas Net worth: $5.4 billion

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Oprah's still holding strong at number three, even with a significant drop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Oprah's still holding strong at number three, even with a significant drop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes' third annual ranking of the net worths of the famous boasted the biggest cumulative figure since we began tallying totals, up 4% from 2017's $18 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the real shocker is Judge Judy filing for bankruptcy with negative 747 million? Like, how does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the real shocker is Judge Judy filing for bankruptcy with negative seven hundred forty seven million? Like, how does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Worlds Highest-Paid TV Hosts 2018: Judge Judy Presides With $147 Million For the first year ever, Judy Sheindlinmore commonly known as Judge Judyr...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And Kylie Jenner didn't even make the top ten—she's down at twentieth place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And Kylie Jenner didn't even make the top ten-she's down at twentieth place.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: New to the list this year is Kylie Jenner, whose $900 million net worth puts her on track to become the youngest self-made billionaire ever.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Her apparel line only made, what, thirty million in two years? That's not great for someone with a million followers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Her apparel line only made, what, thirty million in two years? That's not great for someone with a million followers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 21-year-old runs Kylie Cosmetics, which has shifted more than $630 million in makeup since its launch two years ago by targeting her 168 million-plus social media followers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Jay-Z lost seven hundred million from last year! His stakes in Armand de Brignac and D'Ussé really took a hit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Jay-Z lost seven hundred million from last year! His stakes in Armand de Brignac and D'Ussé really took a hit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His net worth is up $90 million from 2017's figure thanks to lucrative stakes in companies including Armand de Brignac champagne and D'Ussé cognac, plus holdings in his entertainment empire Roc Nation and streaming service Tidal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He even said something about artists being tricked into thinking they can't make money—foreshadowing his own business troubles, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He even said something about artists being tricked into thinking they can't make money-foreshadowing his own business troubles, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That was the greatest trick in music that people ever pulled off, to convince artists that you can't be an artist and make money, Jay-Z told Forbes in 2010, foreshadowing the success of his ancillary businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how the whole list combined is only 6.7 billion, less than Luxembourg's GDP.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how the whole list combined is only six point seven billion, less than Luxembourg's G D P.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: America's 10 wealthiest celebrities hold a combined fortune of $18.7 billion, more than the GDP of Iceland.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Michael Jordan dropped a hundred mil too, partly from the Charlotte Hornets losing value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Michael Jordan dropped a hundred mil too, partly from the Charlotte Hornets losing value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Jordan (No. 4; $1.7 billion) climbs up the ranking with a $400 million net worth increase derived from his sneaker fortune and a 90% stake in the increasingly valuable Charlotte Hornets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So much for sneaker success propping him up, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So much for sneaker success propping him up, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Michael Jordan (No. 4; $1.7 billion) climbs up the ranking with a $400 million net worth increase derived from his sneaker fortune and a 90% stake in the increasingly valuable Charlotte Hornets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it feels like being famous doesn't automatically mean you're set for life anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it feels like being famous doesn't automatically mean you're set for life anymore.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Unless you're Spielberg or Gates, I guess. They're just in another league.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unless you're Spielberg or Gates, I guess. They're just in another league.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For real. Even Diddy beat out Jay-Z this year—only by a tie, but still.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For real. Even Diddy beat out Jay-Z this year-only by a tie, but still.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He bests fellow rapper Diddy (No. 8; $820 million), who is the only other musician on a ranking that also includes an author and a magician.

HostB: Yeah, and George Lucas is way down at number nine with only a hundred million. That’s uh, a pretty big gap.

HostB: But the real shocker is Judge Judy filing for bankruptcy with negative 747 million? Like, how does that even happen?
HostA: Right? And Kylie Jenner didn’t even make the top ten—she’s down at twentieth place.
HostB: Her apparel line only made, what, thirty million in two years? That’s not great for someone with a million followers.
HostA: And Jay-Z lost seven hundred million from last year! His stakes in Armand de Brignac and D'Ussé really took a hit.
HostB: He even said something about artists being tricked into thinking they can’t make money—foreshadowing his own business troubles, honestly.
HostA: It’s wild how the whole list combined is only 6.7 billion, less than Luxembourg’s GDP.
HostB: And Michael Jordan dropped a hundred mil too, partly from the Charlotte Hornets losing value.
HostA: So much for sneaker success propping him up, huh?
HostB: Honestly, it feels like being famous doesn’t automatically mean you’re set for life anymore.
HostA: Unless you’re Spielberg or Gates, I guess. They’re just in another league.
